meanings.definition: An underlying or implicit meaning, as of a literary work.
meanings.sent1: The subtexts in the story added depth to the characters.
meanings.sent2: She could sense the subtexts in his words, hinting at his true feelings.
meanings.sent3: The subtexts in the play made the audience chuckle at the hidden jokes.
meanings.sent4: His paintings were filled with subtexts, revealing his inner struggles.
meanings.sent5: The subtexts of the poem lingered in her mind long after she read it.

meanings.definition: A message beneath the surface of a conversation or text.
meanings.sent1: The subtexts of their chat revealed their true intentions.
meanings.sent2: It's important to pay attention to the subtexts in emails to understand the full message.
meanings.sent3: The subtexts in the movie dialogue made the audience laugh at the hidden meanings.
meanings.sent4: The subtexts of the novel resonated with readers on a deeper level.
meanings.sent5: She was skilled at deciphering the subtexts in social media posts.
